body:
Introduces a new option named 'foldoptions' for customizing the
fold column.

Comes with the word 'nodigits' that disables the digits shown to
indicate the nesting level. Instead 'foldsep' from 'fillchars' is
used.

---

I'm new to neovim hacking and very novice at C, so this is probably just one big mess... but I thought I would try to take a stab at implementing this option as I find the rendering of the nesting level as numbers quite disturbing over just showing the regular separator.

closes #14751

comment_data.body: Shouldn't this be `window` scoped like other fold options?

That's how I implemented this at first (and which I can revert to), after some testing and contemplation I decided to go this way because because it feels like it should be a global setting since it's related to the gutter visuals.
You're probably right here. So I reverted back to window scoped.
Yeah was gonna say `'signcolumn'` and `'number'` are window scoped too.
I think this should also be put after `'foldcolumn'`.

This is just a workaround to simulate the fold signs through the expression, so actually it is not a real foldcolumn (the real foldcolumn is `%C`). This results in the failure of highlighting the foldcolumn by `FoldColumn` highlight group. We have to specify the highlight group explicitly in `statuscolumn` like `%#FoldColumn#%{ ... }%*`.

So I think this PR is still necessary to tweak the foldcolumn directly. If so, we could just use `statuscolumn` to arrange items instead of introducing expressions to tweak items, which will be more efficient and reduct the potential performance overhead.

> I will look into adding support for things like this to [statuscol.nvim](https://github.com/luukvbaal/statuscol.nvim) as well.

So it took some time to get around to this(I don't really use folds myself). I do think there are gaps in the current api to properly emulate the fold column through `'statuscolum'`. As @kevinhwang91 mentioned, we need the information in `foldinfo_T`. ~~Would a builtin `foldinfo({winid}, {lnum})` function be welcome to achieve this @justinmk?~~(EDIT: discussed with Lewis and it was deemed too high-level for an API function) Using that, I was able to emulate a "nodigits" fold column like so:
```lua
function M.foldfunc()
	local fi = f.foldinfo(v.windowid, v.lnum)
	local width = fi.maxdepth
	if width == 0 then return "" end

	local string = "%#FoldColumn#"
	local level = fi.level

	if level == 0 then
		return string..(" "):rep(width).."%#LineNr#"
	end

	-- For each column, add a foldopen, foldclosed, foldsep or whitespace char
	for col = 1, width do
		if col == level and fi.lines > 0 then
			string = string..foldclosed
		elseif fi.start == v.lnum and col >= fi.low_level then
			string = string..foldopen
		else
			string = string..foldsep
		end

		if col == level then
			string = string..(" "):rep(width - col)
			break
		end
	end

	return string.."%#LineNr#"
end
```

> So I think this PR is still necessary to tweak the foldcolumn directly. If so, we could just use statuscolumn to arrange items instead of introducing expressions to tweak items, which will be more efficient and reduct the potential performance overhead.

Although I have no objections to re-opening this PR to tweak the default column directly, performance concerns for the above approach seem to be a non-issue. At least I notice no discernible performance hit with the above approach and the following fold column(default fold column on the right split):
